avalancheActivity.comment:
The large quantity of fresh snow of Tuesday and very particularly the wind slabs can still be released in some cases, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on very steep slopes above approximately 2300 m. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
In isolated cases the avalanches can be triggered in the weakly bonded old snow and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger.

On extremely steep sunny slopes more frequent small and medium-sized moist avalanches are to be expected as the day progresses. Gliding avalanches can also occur at any time, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: For those venturing off piste an unfavourable avalanche situation will be encountered in some localities. Increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 80 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow.
Several small and medium-sized slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days. The various wind slabs have bonded with the old snowpack. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations will stabilise.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last seven days as well as the wind slabs can still be released in some cases, in particular on extremely steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
To some extent avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach medium size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
On extremely steep sunny slopes more frequent small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are to be expected as the day progresses, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weak layers are the main source of danger. Increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations will stabilise.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Little snow fell on Saturday. In addition mostly small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines on west, northwest and north facing slopes and generally in the high Alpine regions. They can still be released, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on very steep slopes.
On extremely steep sunny slopes small to medium-sized moist snow slides are to be expected as the day progresses.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of small moist avalanches will increase.
